plants.name: Chrysanthemum morifolium
plants.description: Chrysanthemums are popular garden plants known for their vibrant, daisy-like flower heads. They bloom profusely in late autumn, adding bright color to gardens as many other plants fade.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, commonly cultivated in North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Chrysanthemums symbolize longevity and rejuvenation in many Asian cultures and are celebrated during autumn festivals.

plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A beautiful evergreen shrub with waxy, rose-like flowers that bloom in the cooler months. It produces showy blossoms throughout fall and winter, providing garden color when many other plants are dormant.
plants.location: Eastern Asia; widely cultivated in gardens in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Camellias were highly prized in 18th-century Europe and inspired the name of the classic novel 'The Lady of the Camellias'.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: Native to South Africa, the King Protea features a large, distinctive flower head resembling a giant artichoke. It blooms in late spring to early summer in the Southern Hemisphere, including November.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is South Africa's national flower and can grow flowers over 12 inches wide.

plants.name: Grevillea robusta
plants.description: An Australian native tree producing striking bright orange to yellow spider-shaped flowers. It blooms mainly in spring but often continues flowering into early summer, including November in the Southern Hemisphere.
plants.location: Eastern Australia; cultivated in subtropical and tropical regions worldwide
plants.funFact: Though called 'Silky Oak,' Grevillea robusta is not a true oak but valued for its timber and ornamental flowers.
